snippet: Rita A. Crundwell, former comptroller of Dixon, Ill., is said to have used the money to pay for a lavish life and a horse-breeding business.
abstract: Rita A Crundwell, former comptroller of Dixon, Ill, pleads guilty in federal court to one count of wire fraud after bilking $53 million from town; prosecutors claim that she had raided town's coffers for decades to pay for lavish life and horse-breeding business.
lead_paragraph: Rita A. Crundwell, former comptroller of Dixon, Ill., is said to have used the money to pay for a lavish life and a horse-breeding business.

headline.main: Former Official Pleads Guilty to Defrauding Illinois Town of $53 Million
headline.print_headline: Former Official Pleads Guilty to Defrauding Illinois Town of $53 Million
